page.title: 15Services/amenities,H.Lorton
page.content: There are approximately{sixty permanently occupied{dwellings}in the village of High Lorton,most of which are within this particular block. The village has mains{electricity, {water}and{sewage,}but{no gas.}Some of the outlying houses and farms still have to have their own water and sewage systems. There is{no bus service,}except for a private mini-bus to the local town, four miles away,on Friday morning,so residents have organised a lifts-rota. The village has one{phone-box}and an automatic{telephone exchange.}It has a {post-office/shop,primary school,public {house,police-house,church,village-hall and{tennis club. {Mail}and{milk}are delivered,but {papers}have to be collected from the shop.The{library-van}calls once a month and{refuse}is collected weekly.
